body: MDD is characterised by a depressed mood: a profound feeling of sadness, emptiness, worthlessness and hopelessness.
Bipolar is characterised by depressive episodes and mania. Mania is characterised by abnormally elevated, expansive, or irritable mood.
The essential feature of GAD is a general feeling of excessive anxiety and worry that is difficult to control.
The occurrence of obsessions, compulsive rituals or, both recurrent and persistent thoughts, impulses, or images that are experienced as intrusive and cause great anxiety.
Recurrent alcohol use resulting in failure to fulfill major role obligations, or recurrent use in situations in which it is physically hazardous.
DID is characterized by the maintenance of at least two distinct and relatively enduring personality states.
Comorbidity, presence of two or more of the above mental disorders in the same period. Symptoms often overlap and can be additive.
A behavioral or mental pattern that causes significant distress or impairment of personal functioning.
BDD is characterized by the obsessive idea that some aspect of one's own body part or appearance is severely flawed.
BPD is characterized by a long-term pattern of unstable relationships, distorted sense of self, and strong emotional reactions.
PSTD is a major psychological disorder that affects many people who survive major traumatic experiences.
Psychosis is a psychiatric syndrome that most commonly occurs in young adults.
An eating disorder is a mental disorder defined by abnormal eating habits that negatively affect a person's physical and/or mental health.
Schizophrenia is a major psychotic illness and a disorder of fragmented mental processes.
